RandomForest :¶

class source.random_forest.TorchRandomForestClassifier(nb_trees, nb_samples, max_depth=-1, bootstrap=True)¶

Torch random forest object used to solve classification problem. This object implements the fitting and prediction function which can be used with torch tensors. The random forest is based on source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeClassifier which are built during the fit() and called recursively during the predict().

Parameters

  • nb_trees (int) – Number of source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeClassifier used to fit the classification problem.

  • nb_samples (int) – Number of vector samples used to fit each source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeClassifier.

  • max_depth (int) – The maximum depth which corresponds to the maximum successive number of DecisionNode.

  • bootstrap (bool) – If set to true, a sample of the dimensions of the input vectors are made during the fitting and the prediction.

fit(vectors, labels)¶

Function which must be used after the initialisation to fit the random forest and build the successive source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeClassifier to solve a specific classification problem.

Parameters

  • vectors (torch.FloatTensor) – Vectors tensor used to fit the random forest. It represents the data and must correspond to the following shape (num_vectors, num_dimensions).

  • labels (torch.LongTensor) – Labels tensor used to fit the decision tree. It represents the labels associated to each vectors and must correspond to the following shape (num_vectors).

predict(vector)¶

Function which must be used after the the fitting of the random forest. It calls recursively the different source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeClassifier to classify the vector.

Parameters

vector (torch.FloatTensor) – Vectors tensor which must be classified. It represents the data and must correspond to the following shape (num_dimensions).

Returns

Tensor which corresponds to the label predicted by the random forest.

Return type

torch.LongTensor

class source.random_forest.TorchRandomForestRegressor(nb_trees, nb_samples, max_depth=-1, bootstrap=True)¶

Torch random forest object used to solve regression problem. This object implements the fitting and prediction function which can be used with torch tensors. The random forest is based on source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeRegressor which are built during the fit() and called recursively during the predict().

Parameters

  • nb_trees (int) – Number of source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeRegressor used to fit the classification problem.

  • nb_samples (int) – Number of vector samples used to fit each source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeRegressor.

  • max_depth (int) – The maximum depth which corresponds to the maximum successive number of source.decision_node.DecisionNode.

  • bootstrap (bool) – If set to true, a sample of the dimensions of the input vectors are made during the fitting and the prediction.

fit(vectors, values)¶

Function which must be used after the initialisation to fit the random forest and build the successive source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeRegressor to solve a specific classification problem.

Parameters

  • vectors (torch.FloatTensor) – Vectors tensor used to fit the decision tree. It represents the data and must correspond to the following shape (num_vectors, num_dimensions_vectors).

  • values (torch.FloatTensor) – Values tensor used to fit the decision tree. It represents the values associated to each vectors and must correspond to the following shape (num_vectors, num_dimensions_values).

predict(vector)¶

Function which must be used after the the fitting of the random forest. It calls recursively the different source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeRegressor to regress the vector.

Parameters

vector (torch.FloatTensor) – Vectors tensor which must be regressed. It represents the data and must correspond to the following shape (num_dimensions).

Returns

Tensor which corresponds to the value regressed by the random forest.

Return type

torch.FloatTensor
